body.instructions: You are an expert in formal verification of System-on-Chip (SoC) designs. You will be provided with (1) a textual description of a specific mechanism (e.g., data transfer, device reset, ...) of an on-chip communication protocol, and (2) a list of candidate signal interaction rules. Your task is to extract the candidate rules that best describe the target mechanism based on the textual description. Do not include rules irrelevant to the target mechanism. Provide the extracted rules in a JSON list format, without any additional commentary or explanation.

content.text:
[
  "If IRDY# is HIGH and TRDY# is LOW, then TRDY# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If IRDY# is HIGH and TRDY# is LOW, then DEVSEL# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If TRDY# changes from HIGH to LOW, then DEVSEL# is LOW.",
  "If FRAME# is HIGH and STOP# is LOW, then STOP# is HIGH in the next cycle.",
  "If FRAME# is LOW and STOP# is LOW, then STOP# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If STOP# is LOW and TRDY# is HIGH, then TRDY# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If IRDY# is HIGH and STOP# is LOW, then TRDY# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If IRDY# is HIGH and STOP# is LOW, then STOP# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If IRDY# is HIGH and STOP# is LOW, then DEVSEL# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If IRDY# is HIGH and TRDY# is LOW, then STOP# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If FRAME# is LOW and IRDY# is LOW and TRDY# is HIGH, then IRDY# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If IRDY# is LOW and STOP# is HIGH and TRDY# is HIGH, then FRAME# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If IRDY# is LOW and STOP# is HIGH and TRDY# is HIGH, then IRDY# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If FRAME# is LOW and STOP# is LOW and TRDY# is HIGH, then TRDY# remains stable in the next cycle.",
  "If FRAME# is LOW and STOP# is LOW and TRDY# is HIGH, then DEVSEL# remains stable in the next cycle."
]
